title: Anybody else excited for Fiddlesticks rework?
body:
Just saying.

I haven't been able to playing him in years (because his kit is so outdated) and his lore has been out of place since the Academy of War disappeared from the lore. 

Lots of work to do here, but lots of potential too…

replies.body: yes

Just gonna point out:
"Turns out that having a cacophony of random people saying things at you is extremely off putting in a gameplay environment (for the player as well as their opponents) Whoops."

Why whoops?  Extremely off putting sounds exactly like what Fiddlesticks should be. That is the single most twisted cool thing in the entire write up.

Let me put it this way. In the jungle, it could easily confuse players who think that a different champion has entered their sight radius or activated an ability nearby. In lane, it can confuse _multiple_ players since VO is a huge gameplay tell for the vast majority of champions, including the person playing Fiddlesticks. It was pointed out that at times it could feel _really_ disorienting. Maybe two VAs would be okay, but definitely not five.

As cool as it might sound on the surface, the gameplay implications were fairly severe. I had to let the idea go. :'''(

Buuuuut for now I'm exploring a different version of that type of script, as I said in the update. My producer was visibly creeped out by the current pass, so I'm feeling pretty good about it. I'll be able to talk about that more **next time on Fiddlesticks Z.**
So make it toggleable.  >.>

Yes, I'm sure a narrative writer had everything to do with that decision.

Go spam Riot Mort if you want answers/change. Or, better yet, don't spam Rioters at all.

Is there any way we could ever hear that first version with the five voices?  I read about that version in the last update on the rework progress and that concept just sounds fascinating from a psychological standpoint.
Do you want to get a headache and nausea every time you play Fiddlesticks? That's an easy way to effectively delete a champion from the game. There's off-putting and then there's _off-putting_.

Not really. I'm one of those who don't understand what's wrong with Fiddle's kit. Imho, it needed an update, not a rework. Its R is iconic, its W is the  quintessence of its kit, its E is amazingly useful and the Q is a nice touch. Besides, if Riot is going to keep just its R, we'll be left with a single life-absorbing champion (that is, Vladi) in the entire game. I like Riot's ideas on a jumpscare Fiddle, but they could have simply reworked his Q and passive, maybe his R too.
